intro: Labatia elliptica, commonly known as the elliptical labatia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, pentagonal flowers in shades of pink and white. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. Labatia elliptica thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
